summary: Logs are not emitted when replaying workflows that use interceptors in the TypeScript SDK. Users need to be able to see logs during workflow replay for debugging purposes.
userImpact: Users cannot debug replayed workflows because logs from interceptors are suppressed during replay, making it difficult to understand workflow behavior.
rootCause: Logs are being filtered out during workflow replay before they reach the configured sinks/interceptors.
proposedFix: Make log emission during replay configurable, similar to the Go SDK approach (https://github.com/temporalio/sdk-go/pull/979).
workaround: Set log configuration on the sinks level using the configuration option in packages/worker/src/sinks.ts
resolutionDetails: The issue was resolved by making log emission during replay configurable at the sinks level, allowing users to opt-in to receiving logs during workflow replay.
keyQuote: I agree that we should allow logs to be emitted during replays, we just got a contribution for Go SDK to make this configurable.
